results.title: The Campaign
results.creator_credit: Debra Choate, ABC-TV (Australia), Frontline Television Productions and Santo Cilauro
results.brief_description: The Campaign is a surprising political documentary where the anatomy of a federal campaign has been laid bare: the logistics, the travelling, the locations, the surroundings and the schedule. For the full 35 days of the 1996 Federal Election campaign, Santo Cilauro and his video-camera followed the then Prime Minister Paul Keating, his entourage and the media pack, around Australia to give a revealing insight into the physical nature of campaigning for the nation’s highest office. An inside view of how our view is formed in an era where the election battle is fought with the 15 second grab, this two part program is a dynamic display of how the moment is manufactured. Covering 35 days, 150 journalists, 40,000km, 11 million voters and one man in the middle, The Campaign shows why people describe Australian elections like no other in the world.

results.title: The Camp
results.creator_credit: Stanley Wright, United Nations and Georges Pessis
results.brief_description: Commentary spoken by Ingrid Bergman. Tells of a woman and her family who have lived in a refugee camp for ten years. They have had to rely on other’s charity because they could not work, and must wait to start new lives while others leave. The film ends as a challenge - the refugee camps will be burned as empty buildings if nations can give their help.

results.title: The Camera and the tripod
results.creator_credit: John A. Givins, Lynn John and KTV Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Video tech”.
This episode deals with what the camera sees - focus and shot sizes, how to make pictures look better and how to zoom, pan and tilt.

results.title: The Camera
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, CBS, KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.) and Coast Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Photographic artist and educator Mark Johnstone uses a view camera to demonstrate and describe basic features common to all cameras. Illustrates the advantages and disadvantages of various types of cameras. Guest photographers explain how their particular cameras are ideal for their types of photography.

results.title: The Camel who took a walk (K)
results.brief_description: From the book written by Jack Tworkov, illustrated by Roger Duvoisin, this children’s film tells the story of a camel and what “did not” happen to him as he set out for his morning walk. Uses the pictures and text from the book. Suitable for pre-school level.

results.title: The Calling
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts and Lisa Chambers
results.brief_description: Madeline O’Connor is the perfect student and one destined to be a nun (according to her mother and the Sisters around her at school). Madeline has other ideas however and dreams of being a ballerina. She does everything in her power to misbehave and ward off any potential angels that might be tempted to come to her during the night - thus signalling she has been chosen by god. This is an uplifting comedy about ambition and fate.

results.title: The Cage (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Art of silence: pantomimes with Marcel Marceau and his partner Pierre Verry”.
Allegorical pantomime performed by Marcel Marceau showing a person struggling to escape from confinement- an enclosure of invisible walls. Marceau’s groping movements and final breakthrough, only to find another invisible wall, express mankind’s continuing struggle for enlightenment. Marceau believes that “we have but to walk out of the cage”. Also features his partner Pierre Verry. Suitable for upper secondary school level.

results.title: The Cactus: profile of a plant
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Edward C. Harris
results.brief_description: Examines the structure life functions of the cactus in its natural environment by means of close-up time lapse photography. Explains the ability of the cactus to survive in the harsh desert environment.

results.title: The Cactus: adaptations for survival
results.brief_description: This film explains how the cactus has been able to adapt successfully to harsh environments through its unique physical characteristics and lifecycle. Demonstrates its water-conserving characteristics. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
